_header: Adam scrivein if ever it thee befall
Subjects: advice; verse curse; chastisement; manuscripts, production of
_description: ‘Chaucer’s wordes unto Adam’ — one stanza rhyme royal

CULGg4271b.First Lines:
Adam sciuener if ever thee befallBoece or Troylus for to write
                    new…
CULGg4271b.Last Lines:
…it to correct and eke to rubbe and scrapeand all is thorowe
                    thy necgligence and rape
CULGg4271b.Note:
Copied by a hand of the seventeenth century from Speght (1598)

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Adam scryveyne if euer it þe byfalleBoece or Troylus for to
                    wryten nuweVnder þy long lokkes þowe most haue þe
                    scalleBut affter my makyng þowe wryte more truwe…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…It to corect and eke to rubbe and scrapeAnd al is thorugh
                    þy necglygence and rape
